questions.question: What are the Millenium Prize Problems, which areas of mathematics do they belong to and who discovered them?
questions.query: SELECT DISTINCT ?problem ?problem_label (GROUP_CONCAT(?area_label; separator='; ') AS ?area_labels) (GROUP_CONCAT(?discoverer_label; separator='; ') AS ?discoverer_labels) WHERE { ?problem p:P361/ps:P361 wd:Q727000 . ?problem @en@rdfs:label ?problem_label . OPTIONAL { ?problem p:P2579/ps:P2579 ?area . ?area @en@rdfs:label ?area_label . } OPTIONAL { ?problem p:P61/ps:P61 ?discoverer . ?discoverer @en@rdfs:label ?discoverer_label . } } GROUP BY ?problem ?problem_label
questions.results_comparison: Results match, but Wikidata lacks almost all values for attributes 'area' and 'discoverer'.

questions.question: Which US president was played by the most actors in a movie?
questions.query: SELECT ?president ?presidentLabel (GROUP_CONCAT(DISTINCT ?actorLabel;separator='; ') AS ?actorLabels) (COUNT(DISTINCT ?actor) AS ?numActors) WHERE { ?president p:P39/ps:P39 wd:Q11696 . ?president p:P31/ps:P31 wd:Q5 . ?movie p:P31/ps:P31/p:P279*/ps:P279* wd:Q11424 . ?movie p:P161 ?p161 . ?p161 ps:P161 ?actor . ?president ^pq:P453 ?p161 . ?president @en@rdfs:label ?presidentLabel . ?actor @en@rdfs:label ?actorLabel . } GROUP BY ?president ?presidentLabel ORDER BY DESC(?numActors) LIMIT 1
questions.results_comparison: Different results: According to Wikidata, Nixon was played by most actors (16). According to Wikipedia, Lincoln was played by most actors (27) and Nixon by only 15. Main reason for discrepancy: For many actors the role information (who they played in their movies) was missing.

questions.question: European volcanoes that erupted in the last century
questions.query: SELECT DISTINCT ?volcano ?volcano_label WHERE { ?volcano p:P31/ps:P31/p:P279*/ps:P279* wd:Q8072 . ?volcano @en@rdfs:label ?volcano_label . { ?volcano p:P30/ps:P30 wd:Q46 . } UNION { ?volcano p:P17/ps:P17 ?country . ?country (p:P361/ps:P361)+ wd:Q46 . } ?volcano p:P793 ?p793 . { ?p793 ps:P793 wd:Q7692360 . ?p793 ?time_info ?start_time . VALUES ?time_info { pq:P580 pq:585 } } UNION { ?p793 ps:P793 ?significant_event . ?significant_event p:P279+/ps:P279+ wd:Q7692360 . ?p793 ?time_info ?start_time . } UNION { ?p793 ps:P793 ?significant_event . ?significant_event p:P31/ps:P31 wd:Q7692360 . ?significant_event ?time_info_1 ?tmp . ?tmp ?time_info_2 ?start_time . VALUES ?time_info_1 { p:P580 p:P585 } VALUES ?time_info_2 { ps:P580 ps:P585 } } FILTER (?start_time >= '1923-01-01T00:00:00Z'^^xsd:dateTime) } ORDER BY ASC(?volcano_label)
questions.results_comparison: Different results, mostly because data is missing on Wikidata.

questions.question: Pandemics that were worse than Covid?
questions.query: SELECT ?pandemic ?pandemic_label (MAX(?pandemic_death_toll_data) AS ?pandemic_deaths) (SAMPLE(?covid_death_toll) AS ?covid_deaths) WHERE { ?pandemic p:P31/ps:P31 wd:Q12184 . ?pandemic @en@rdfs:label ?pandemic_label . ?pandemic p:P1120/ps:P1120 ?pandemic_death_toll_data . BIND(1 as ?tmp) { SELECT (MAX(?covid_death_toll_data) AS ?covid_death_toll) (1 as ?tmp) WHERE { wd:Q81068910 p:P1120/ps:P1120 ?covid_death_toll_data . } } } GROUP BY ?pandemic ?pandemic_label HAVING (?pandemic_deaths > ?covid_deaths) ORDER BY DESC(?pandemic_deaths)
questions.results_comparison: Different results because of divergent classification of some -demics as '(plague) epidemic' rather than 'pandemic'.

questions.question: Full recreation of list 'List of actor-politicians', section 'Europe'
questions.query: SELECT DISTINCT ?person ?person_label ?country_label (GROUP_CONCAT(?party_label) AS ?political_party) (GROUP_CONCAT(?position_label) AS ?political_career) WHERE { ?person p:P27/ps:P27 ?country . ?country (p:P361/ps:P361)+ wd:Q46 . ?country @en@rdfs:label ?country_label . ?person @en@rdfs:label ?person_label . ?person p:P106/ps:P106/(p:P279/ps:P279)* wd:Q82955 . ?person p:P106/ps:P106/(p:P279/ps:P279)* wd:Q33999 . OPTIONAL { ?person p:P102/ps:P102 ?party . ?party @en@rdfs:label ?party_label . } OPTIONAL { ?person p:P39/ps:P39 ?position_held . ?position_held @en@rdfs:label ?position_label . } } GROUP BY ?person ?person_label ?country_label ORDER BY ASC(?country_label)
questions.results_comparison: Different results: vastly more results on Wikidata than in the Wikipedia list. Despite that, people from the Wikipedia list are missing in the Wikidata output. Main reason is missing data on Wikidata, e.g., a missing politics-related occupation statement.

questions.question: Full recreation of list 'List of most-followed TikTok accounts'
questions.query: SELECT ?username ?owner ?owner_label ?num_followers ?description (GROUP_CONCAT(?country_label) AS ?countries) WHERE { ?owner p:P106/ps:P106 wd:Q94791573 . ?owner @en@rdfs:label ?owner_label . ?owner p:P8687 ?social_media_followers . ?social_media_followers ps:P8687 ?num_followers . ?social_media_followers pq:P7085 ?username . ?social_media_followers pq:P585 ?latest_count . ?owner @en@schema:description ?description . ?owner p:P27/ps:P27 ?country . ?country @en@rdfs:label ?country_label . {SELECT ?owner (MAX(?count) AS ?latest_count) WHERE { ?owner p:P106/ps:P106 wd:Q94791573 . ?owner p:P8687 ?social_media_followers . ?social_media_followers pq:P7085 ?username . ?social_media_followers pq:P585 ?count . } GROUP BY ?owner } } GROUP BY ?owner ?username ?owner_label ?num_followers ?description ORDER BY DESC(?num_followers) LIMIT 50
questions.results_comparison: Different results: The top 5 of each (output/result) list were considered. All Wikidata entities are also found in the Wikipedia list, but some entities from the Wikipedia list are missing in the Wikidata results because they lack the TikToker occupation statement.

questions.question: Full recreation of list 'List of largest mosques'
questions.query: SELECT DISTINCT ?mosque ?mosque_label (SAMPLE(?img) AS ?image) ?capacity (SAMPLE(?city_label) AS ?city_labels) ?country_label ?year_first_built WHERE { ?mosque p:P31/ps:P31/(p:P279/ps:P279)* wd:Q32815 . ?mosque @en@rdfs:label ?mosque_label . ?mosque p:P1083/ps:P1083 ?capacity . OPTIONAL { ?mosque p:P18/ps:P18 ?img . } OPTIONAL { ?mosque p:P131/ps:P131 ?city . ?city @en@rdfs:label ?city_label . } OPTIONAL { ?mosque p:P17/ps:P17 ?country . ?country @en@rdfs:label ?country_label . } OPTIONAL { { VALUES ?construction { wd:Q27136782 wd:Q18752057 } ?mosque p:P793/ps:P793 ?construction . ?mosque p:P793/pq:P585 ?min_construction . } UNION  { ?mosque p:P571/ps:P571 ?min_construction . } { SELECT ?mosque (MIN(?construction_time) AS ?min_construction) WHERE { ?mosque p:P31/ps:P31/(p:P279/ps:P279)* wd:Q32815 . { VALUES ?construction { wd:Q27136782 wd:Q18752057 } ?mosque p:P793/ps:P793 ?construction . ?mosque p:P793/pq:P585 ?construction_time . } UNION { ?mosque p:P571/ps:P571 ?construction_time . } } GROUP BY ?mosque } } BIND(YEAR(?min_construction) AS ?year_first_built) } GROUP BY ?mosque ?mosque_label ?capacity ?country_label ?year_first_built ORDER BY DESC(?capacity)
questions.results_comparison: Different results: The top 5 of each (output/result) list were considered. There are various reasons for the discrepancies: non-classification as a mosque by Wikidata, missing 'maximum capacity' value on Wikidata (needed for sorting), item missing from Wikipedia List for unknown reasons. Raiwind Markaz is probably not classified as a single mosque but a mosque complex. Side note: Mosques on Wikidata seem to lack an 'area' property.

questions.question: Full recreation of list 'List of endangered languages in Europe', section 'Germany'
questions.query: SELECT DISTINCT ?lang ?lang_label ?endangered_label (GROUP_CONCAT(DISTINCT ?country_label) AS ?spoken_in) (GROUP_CONCAT(DISTINCT ?short) AS ?code) WHERE { ?lang p:P1999/ps:P1999 ?endangered . ?endangered @en@rdfs:label ?endangered_label . VALUES ?endangered { wd:Q20672087 wd:Q20672088 wd:Q20672089 wd:Q20672090 } { wd:Q183 p:P2936/ps:P2936 ?lang . } UNION { ?lang p:P17/ps:P17 wd:Q183 . } ?lang @en@rdfs:label ?lang_label . OPTIONAL { ?lang p:P17/ps:P17 ?country . ?country @en@rdfs:label ?country_label . } OPTIONAL { ?lang p:P424/ps:P424 ?short . } } GROUP BY ?lang ?lang_label ?endangered_label ORDER BY ?lang_label
questions.results_comparison: Different results: The main reason is that languages from the Wikipedia list are missing in the Wikidata output as these languages lack a connection to Germany on Wikidata.

questions.question: Full recreation of list 'Best selling pharmaceuticals of U.S. Market'
questions.query: SELECT DISTINCT ?drug ?drug_label (GROUP_CONCAT(DISTINCT ?med_cond_label) as ?med_cond_labels) (GROUP_CONCAT(DISTINCT ?product_label) AS ?trade_names) ?sitelinks WHERE { ?drug p:P31/ps:P31 wd:Q12140 . ?drug @en@rdfs:label ?drug_label . ?drug p:P3780/ps:P3780 ?product . ?product @en@rdfs:label ?product_label . VALUES ?against_1 { p:P2175 p:P4954 } . VALUES ?against_2 { ps:P2175 ps:P4954 } . ?drug ?against_1 ?tmp . ?tmp ?against_2 ?med_cond . ?med_cond @en@rdfs:label ?med_cond_label . ?drug ^schema:about/wikibase:sitelinks ?sitelinks . } GROUP BY ?drug ?drug_label ?sitelinks ORDER BY DESC(?sitelinks)
questions.results_comparison: The results cannot be compared because Wikidata is lacking a sales property for pharmaceuticals/drugs. Sorting by descending sitelinks instead, lead to very different results. The class used to retrieve the items from Wikidata ('medication') is also used for the drugs listed in the Wikipedia list.

questions.question: Creation of list similar to 'List of twins': Output famous twins born after 1950 with some information about them'
questions.query: SELECT DISTINCT ?person ?person_label ?person_desc ?birthdate ?sibling ?sibling_label ?sibling_desc WHERE { ?person p:P569/ps:P569 ?birthdate . FILTER(?birthdate < '2024-00-00T00:00:00Z'^^xsd:dateTime) ?person p:P25/ps:P25 ?mother . ?person @en@rdfs:label ?person_label . ?sibling p:P25/ps:P25 ?mother . ?sibling @en@rdfs:label ?sibling_label . FILTER(?sibling != ?person) ?sibling p:P569/ps:P569 ?birthdate . ?person ^schema:about/wikibase:sitelinks ?sitelinks . ?person @en@schema:description ?person_desc .  ?sibling @en@schema:description ?sibling_desc . } ORDER BY DESC(?sitelinks)
questions.results_comparison: Results are hard to compare because the Wikipedia list is very large. However, 9 of the top 10 Wikidata result entities are featured in the Wikipedia list, the exception being Ilse Aichinger with her twin sister Helga Michie. Note that the birthday filter (before 2024) needed to be set to eliminate historic people born before Christ and that the query takes a few seconds to run in QLever. To reduce the runtime of the query, we refrained from using p/ps instead of wdt for this example.

questions.question: Full recreation of list 'List of countries whose capital is not their largest city'
questions.query: SELECT DISTINCT ?country ?countryLabel ?capital ?capitalLabel ?population1 ?largest_city ?largest_cityLabel ?population2 ?ratio WHERE {{{{?country p:P31/ps:P31 wd:Q6256 . ?country p:P36 ?p36 . ?p36 ps:P36 ?capital . ?p36 pq:P580 ?max_date . MINUS {?country p:P31/ps:P31 ?excluded . VALUES ?excluded { wd:Q15634554 wd:Q3024240 }}} { SELECT ?country (MAX(?date) AS ?max_date) WHERE { ?country p:P31/ps:P31 wd:Q6256 . ?country p:P36 ?p36 . ?p36 pq:P580 ?date . MINUS { ?p36 pq:P582 ?end_date . } } GROUP BY ?country } { SELECT ?capital (MAX(?time1) AS ?max_time1) WHERE { ?country p:P31/ps:P31 wd:Q6256 . ?country p:P36/ps:P36 ?capital . ?capital p:P1082/pq:P585 ?time1 . } GROUP BY ?capital} } { SELECT ?country (MAX(?population) AS ?population2) WHERE { {?country p:P31/ps:P31 wd:Q6256 . ?city p:P31/ps:P31/(p:P279/ps:P279)* wd:Q515 . ?city p:P17/ps:P17 ?country . } ?city p:P1082 ?p2 . ?p2 ps:P1082 ?population. ?p2 pq:P585 ?max_time2 . { SELECT ?city (MAX(?time2) AS ?max_time2) WHERE { ?city p:P31/ps:P31/(p:P279/ps:P279)* wd:Q515 . ?city p:P1082/pq:P585 ?time2 . } GROUP BY ?city } } GROUP BY ?country } ?capital p:P1082 ?p1 . ?p1 ps:P1082 ?population1 . ?p1 pq:P585 ?max_time1 . ?largest_city p:P31/ps:P31/(p:P279/ps:P279)* wd:Q515 . ?largest_city p:P17/ps:P17 ?country . ?largest_city p:P1082/ps:P1082 ?population2 . } BIND(?population2/?population1 AS ?ratio) . FILTER(?capital != ?largest_city) ?capital @en@rdfs:label ?capitalLabel . ?largest_city @en@rdfs:label ?largest_cityLabel . ?country @en@rdfs:label ?countryLabel . } ORDER BY DESC(?ratio)
questions.results_comparison: Due to data missing on Wikidata, some countries, like India and Palau, do not appear in the QLever output. There are also discrepancies with regard to the population counts used for some countries (e.g., Tanzania and Burundi). Besides, there is of course no section in Wikidata that corresponds to the 'Notes' column of the Wikipedia List
